alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 10:56AM PST until March 11 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Salinas River At Paso Robles affecting San Luis Obispo County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...The river is forecast to reach at least minor flood stage. * WHERE...Salinas River At Paso Robles. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At a river stage of 29 feet, flooding in and around Atascadero is expected, with flooding impacts to nearby Highway 41 and Halcon Road. While uncertain, it is possible that flood impacts could extend to Paso Robles area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PST Friday the stage was 26.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to at least 29 feet late this afternoon. It is expected to fall below flood stage by Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 100 PM PST.
